text.headline: Ancient Civilizations
text.text: The period from 5000 BCE to 500 CE, focusing on the foundations of gender norms in ancient civilizations.

text.headline: Mesopotamia
text.text: Gender roles were rigidly defined and deeply rooted in societal structures. Men engaged in public life, politics, and warfare, while women were confined to domestic roles. The Code of Hammurabi enforced strict gender roles with women having limited rights compared to men.

text.headline: Egypt
text.text: Gender roles in Egypt were more fluid than in Mesopotamia. Women of lower classes often worked alongside men in fields and trade.

text.headline: Greece

text.headline: Rome
text.text: The patriarchal structure reinforced male dominance, yet women in wealthy families could wield significant influence within their households.
